title: Rockson1
author: Rockson1
content: There  came a day in my working place last weekend while we are less busy in the shop where I work because of the love I have for bitcoin I have to introduced it to my junior workers in the shop where I work, while telling them about bitcoin club an crypto space they where so happy an interested in the topic I told them  how I feel here when ever I login to the forum,how I see so many critics an encouraging in the forum they where so happy an excited I now go on an told them how I use my salary to invest on bitcoin they where so surprise,I now proceed and tell them how we are coming up with a welcome development how the supermarket will soon start accepting bitcoin as means of exchange because of the cashless policy in the country an scarcity of currency, they where all excited to hear that from me as their manager in the supermarket,they even go ahead an aske some questions on how they Can join the forum,what are the criteria to join the forum, how to invest in bitcoin,some even ask how to trade, some even ask how can someone be financial independent,or succeed through this forum, I told them is not easy to be here but u can be here also if only u are ready to lean from the forum told about some authors to read that can boost their knowledge.please I need you advice as a new beginner what to teach them as co workers.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: OP, this story is so rigorous. I don't doubt your story, but I don't know if you heard yourself at all. The part where you said you guys are planning to accept Bitcoin payment in the supermarket: is it that you own a supermarket that you are running while you are still working for another company, or is it that you are working in that supermarket where you are teaching your junior colleague about Bitcoin? When creating a thread, don't be in a hurry to do so; always take your time to draft a good and comprehensive thread that can be well understood by your readers, even if the grammar is not well arranged but should be easy to comprehend. It's obvious to me that you just created this thread in such a hurry. And by the way, telling your co-workers that you invested your salary in Bitcoin without telling them the risks involved is discouraged. When you introduce Bitcoin to people, you should also tell them about the risks involved.

comments.body: Quote from: Rockson1 on March 15, 2023, 08:16:52 PMThere  came a day in my working place last weekend while we are less busy in the shop where I work because of the love I have for bitcoin I have to introduced it to my junior workers in the shop where I work, while telling them about bitcoin club an crypto space they where so happy an interested in the topic I told them  how I feel here when ever I login to the forum,how I see so many critics an encouraging in the forum they where so happy an excited I now go on an told them how I use my salary to invest on bitcoin they where so surprise,I now proceed and tell them how we are coming up with a welcome development how the supermarket will soon start accepting bitcoin as means of exchange because of the cashless policy in the country an scarcity of currency, they where all excited to hear that from me as their manager in the supermarket,they even go ahead an aske some questions on how they Can join the forum,what are the criteria to join the forum, how to invest in bitcoin,some even ask how to trade, some even ask how can someone be financial independent,or succeed through this forum, I told them is not easy to be here but u can be here also if only u are ready to lean from the forum told about some authors to read that can boost their knowledge.please I need you advice as a new beginner what to teach them as co workers.I’m really not sorry to say that your post seems ridiculous to me. It’s amusing to know that you love bitcoin so much, you were eager to introduce it to your junior workers without actually knowing what and how to teach them.I think it’s safe to assume that someone who needs advice on what and how to teach someone about bitcoin doesn’t know a lot or nothing at all about bitcoin so I think it’s really strange that someone who doesn’t know a lot about bitcoin would go on to use his income to invest in bitcoin. How then, as the manager of the supermarket do you intend to implement the use of bitcoin for your easy transactions?Some of the questions your junior workers asked seemed quite odd to me. Signing up on the forum isn’t rocket science and we all know there isn’t any criteria needed for someone to signup. What was odd is, why would they ask how someone can be financially independent or succeed through this forum? I’m honestly curious on why they would ask that so if you could make me understand, that would be lovely. Although, I hope you mentioned to them that you can’t be financially independent or succeed through this forum. I do wonder where they got the notion from. I also think you gave them the wrong notion about the forum. It is very easy to be here as you can literally just be here. All you have to do is to follow the unofficial rules like everybody else and you’re good to go. Not so hard right?I do hope your junior workers odd excitement to learn about bitcoin isn’t fake or short lived

comments.author: Luffygroove
comments.created_time: March 16, 2023, 03:24:18 AMLast edit: March 16, 2023, 04:00:18 AM by Luffygroove
comments.body: Well, I'm trying to see this from bright sight where more new people come to join the crypto community. However, please note that means you have a responsible too to educate them. By this responsibility, you also need to improve your knowledge about cryptocurrency. Strengththen your fundamentals so you guide the new people right. In my opinion, here are some topics that can be shared with them : 1. Introduction to Bitcoin and blockchain technology: Explain what Bitcoin is and how it works, including the concept of blockchain technology.2. Wallets and exchanges: Teach them how to set up a Bitcoin wallet and how to buy and sell Bitcoin on a cryptocurrency exchange.3. Risk management: Explain the risks associated with investing in cryptocurrencies and how to manage those risks.4. Technical analysis: Teach them how to analyze cryptocurrency market trends and charts to make informed investment decisions.5. Security: Emphasize the importance of securing their Bitcoin and other cryptocurrency assets by using strong passwords, two-factor authentication, and other security measures.6. Community and resources: Introduce them to Bitcoin forums and other online resources where they can learn more and get involved in the cryptocurrency community.Note : please don't just throw them to the forum without giving them a proper understanding about how to mingle here. Good luck.

comments.body: Op, I see the loopholes in what you did. You said in your post that you'll soon implement bitcoin as a payment option and your fellow workers were happy,  how do people celebrate what they don't know? It just does not sound realistic, no offense. And again you probably should be aware by now that you should only invest what you can afford to lose both in bitcoin and any other investment whatsoever, and you investing your salary in Bitcoin was not a smart move if you ask me because you would need that money anytime soon and prolly that time might be a bear period, and you might be forced to sell which will lead to you realizing a loss instead of profiting.

It's really awesome that the OP has told his team mates about his journey of using Bitcoin and investing his salary into it, that shows that he's truly interested in Bitcoin.In some of his words he's trying to introduce them to this forum, which is really a genuine step towards learning of Bitcoin as this forum is filled with stuff related to Bitcoin. I'm very happy to see that people are adopting Bitcoin as a payment system in their work place. Back to Op, if you really want to teach them about Bitcoin then this forum is the most reliable source of information for their learning. Other than this forum, you may should encourage them to read the white paper of Bitcoin that's freely available at Bitcoin.org, other than these sources you should also tell them to check sites like Coinmarketcap and Coingecko if they want to see charts of Bitcoin and other details about it.The above mentioned sources are most reliable and they are beginner friendly, you should also tell them to learn about Blockchain and Bitcoin as much as possible from these sources before investing their money into it. I hope these resources should be enough for them to learn the basics of Blockchain and Bitcoin.
